meanings.definition: Resembling a drone in sound or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The drony sound of the fan put me to sleep.
meanings.sent2: The drony hum of the bees filled the garden.
meanings.sent3: His drony voice made the lecture feel like a lullaby.
meanings.sent4: The drony engine noise blended with the background.
meanings.sent5: The drony buzz of the mosquito was annoyingly persistent.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a monotonous or repetitive tone.
meanings.sent1: The drony music played softly in the elevator.
meanings.sent2: Her drony speech made it hard to stay awake.
meanings.sent3: The drony movie soundtrack almost put me to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The drony rain tapped on the window all night.
meanings.sent5: The drony ticking of the clock echoed in the room.

meanings.definition: A person who speaks in a dull or monotonous manner.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was a drony who could make any topic boring.
meanings.sent2: The meeting drony went on and on about the same topic.
meanings.sent3: The drony at the party talked about paint drying.
meanings.sent4: The tour guide was a drony who put everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The drony's speech was like listening to a broken record.
